newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian PM no billionaire - spokesman.
newsitem.headline: Russian PM no billionaire - spokesman.

text.p: Russian Prime Minister Viktor Chrnomyrdin earned less than $700 a month in 1996 and had no major property holdings, a government spokesman said on Thursday, denying media reports that the premier was among the world's richest people.
Interfax news agency quoted Igor Shabdurasulov as saying the annual income of Russia's second top official after President Boris Yeltsin totalled 46.39 million roubles ($8,000) last year.
Shabdurasulov denied media reports that Chernomyrdin had $5 billion in shares of Russia's Gazprom gas monopoly. Chernomyrdin headed the firm before he joined the Russian government.
"There was no such thing as Gazprom shares when Chernomyrdin became premier," he said.
Shabdurasulov said that virtually everything Chernomyrdin used now belonged to the state, rather than to him personally.

"He has no country palaces, mansions or such which would count as his own," he said. "Viktor Chernomyrdin lives at a state country residence where everything, apart from personal belongings, belongs to the state.
